verses.roman:
eka eva cared bhikṣur
ātmārāmo 'napāśrayaḥ
sarva-bhūta-suhṛc-chānto
nārāyaṇa-parāyaṇaḥ

synonyms: ekaḥ—alone; eva—only; caret—can move; bhikṣuḥ—a sannyāsī taking alms; ātma-ārāmaḥ—fully satisfied in the self; anapāśrayaḥ—without depending on anything; sarva-bhūta-suhṛt—becoming a well-wisher of all living entities; śāntaḥ—completely peaceful; nārāyaṇa-parāyaṇaḥ—becoming absolutely dependent on Nārāyaṇa and becoming His devotee.
translation: The sannyāsī, completely satisfied in the self, should live on alms begged from door to door. Not being dependent on any person or any place, he should always be a friendly well-wisher to all living beings and be a peaceful, unalloyed devotee of Nārāyaṇa. In this way he should move from one place to another.
